page.title: 14Transport in Cockerham
page.content: The village has many forms of transport, the most popular being the motor car,serviced by two garages There is a bus service which runs from Lancaster seven times per day.School children attending Secondary schools in Lancaster use this bus service.They are brought to a central point in the village by a local school taxi,then by bus on to Lancaster.All farmers in the village have tractors which they use to move their goods.Many have cattle trailers pulled by their cars,to take their stock to market.There is one Haulage Contractor in the village who has three trucks,each capable of carrying about 20 tonnes.These are mostly engaged in hauling stone from quarries North of Lancaster for the building trade throughout Lancashire.The builders have small vans which they use for business.
